node.title: Add model for iCubGenova11
node.body:
The `iCubGenova11` is an iCub 2.7, so we generated the model accordingly.

It also fixes https://github.com/robotology/icub-models-generator/issues/255 to ensure that CI is green. I manually run the CI to push the generated files in https://github.com/robotology/icub-models/tree/addicubgenova11 for testing @martinaxgloria .

node.title: Fix for unneeded path fixing in Windows
node.body:
In Windows, there was an error (described in the linear ticket for this task). I _believe_ this is because in windows, there is no trailing slash included in the path, so there is an out of bounds error when trimming the path because of a -1 index.

However, I have no access to a Windows computer rn, so I cannot confirm that this works. However, I did the next best thing and had GPT review this error, and it came to the same conclusion and reasoning, so I'm pretty confident this should work... https://chat.openai.com/share/1b7c364c-9a91-4ac1-ba2e-f14e1560d2ef

---

Find the pull request instructions [here](https://www.notion.so/regressiongg/Pull-Request-Process-0d57a7eb582a446983edfacafa406f1e?pvs=4)

Every reviewer and the owner of the PR should consider these points in their request (feel free to copy this checklist so you can fill it out yourself in the overall PR comment)

- [ ] The code is extensible and backward compatible
- [ ] New public interfaces are extensible and open to backward compatibility in the future
- [ ] If preparing to remove a field in the future (i.e. this PR removes an argument), the argument stays but is no longer functional, and attaches a deprecation warning. A linear task is also created to track this deletion task.
- [ ] Non-critical or potentially modifiable arguments are optional
- [ ] Breaking changes and the approach to handling them have been verified with the team (in the Linear task, design doc, or PR itself)
- [ ] The code is easy to read
- [ ] Unit tests are added for expected and edge cases
- [ ] Integration tests are added for expected and edge cases
- [ ] Functions and classes are documented
- [ ] Migrations for both up and down operations are completed
- [ ] A documentation PR is created and being reviewed for anything in this PR that requires knowledge to use
- [ ] Implications on other dependent code (i.e. sample games and sample bots) is considered, mentioned, and properly handled
- [ ] Style changes and other non-blocking changes are marked as non-blocking from reviewers

node.title: Enhanced error handling in key functions
node.body:
# Enhanced error handling in key functions:
- Added specific exception handling to 'summarize' and 'get_next_action_from_openai' functions for improved reliability and debugging.
- Introduced granular error handling for FileNotFound, Permission, Image, I/O, Base64 encoding, API request, and other potential exceptions.

node.bodyText: Instead of adding additional lines for every exception, we can have only one line to capture all the exceptions.

Lines 473 - 484 are redundant as 388-412.
We should try to optimize this such that we should not repeat code

Why once you print and again you return ?
Do you do any thing on returning? Why you didn't print on function result?

node.title: feat: improve footer
node.body: This PR aims at improving the footer of the website (navigation, logo, background of light theme). It is related to the issue #353 Still to be done : center the column -> help needed. ## Summary by CodeRabbit - **Documentation** - Updated the footer section with new links and sections for improved navigation and resource accessibility. - **Style** - Enhanced the footer's visual appeal with a new gradient background. - Improved the layout of the footer for better alignment and readability using flexbox properties.

Analysis chain

Script:
#!/bin/bash
# Verify the URLs added to the footer. Expecting HTTP status 200 for all.
urls=(
  'https://okp4.network'
  'https://chat.openai.com/g/g-zUzcYmVbX-okp4-druid-oracle-beta'
  'https://t.me/okp4network'
  'https://zealy.io/c/okp4/questboard'
  'https://explore.okp4.network/OKP4%20testnet'
  'https://faucet.okp4.network'
)

for url in "${urls[@]}"; do
  if ! curl --output /dev/null --silent --head --fail "$url"; then
    echo "URL check failed for $url"
  else
    echo "URL check passed for $url"
  fi
done

https://faucet.okp4.network is indeed down, but we're dealing with it.

node.title: WIP - Improve docker images for faster build and deploy
node.body: Creating a base Dockerfile for this project so that it can be used in `.controlplane/Dockerfile` to speed up the build time. - This file is based on Rails 7.1 Dockerfile. - The Docker base image should be built from `Dockerfile_base` and pushed to the Docker hub. - For deploying on Control Plane, we should use `.controlplane/Dockerfile_from_base`. For this, we need to uncomment the line for the custom Dockerfile path in `.controlplane/controlplane.yml` file. These new Dockerfiles are made originally with the idea of having a way to make a faster build/deploy process on cpln. We still need the existing Dockerfiles to have more control and flexibility when experimenting with deployment. ## Result: ![Screenshot from 2023-12-09 19-36-43-e](https://github.com/shakacode/react-webpack-rails-tutorial/assets/11241315/adf8c7c7-3e7f-422a-ac77-15224020386d) - - - This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/shakacode/react-webpack-rails-tutorial/563)

node.bodyText:
@dzirtusss should this be recommended?
See https://chat.openai.com/share/f7e6d78b-ab5c-4e2f-808c-12c717053613
@ahangarha why is this duplicated in the bin script in this PR?
Why is postgresql-client installed? I tried to find references to psql and couldn't find it.
Is it worth it having a separate build step image vs a single one where you delete the unneeded stuff afterward? You already did some cleaning on line 37.
It comes from Rails new Dockerfile.

I just followed the Dockerfile proposed by Rails.
It might still be faulty, but it follows the same structure.
The bin/docker-entrypoint file comes from new Rails setup.

WTFs:

personal name.
need comments on why file exists and how to use

The reason behind this was that before pushing this base image to the official docker hub of the company, I could demonstrate deployment. I needed a review on the implementation of this Docker base image. Now I got it and now I can move forward.
why the -e flag?
This is going to confuse people.

I understand.
Perhaps we can move these files into .shakacode folder which will be the place for keeping files only related to our development tasks.

I applied it based on the new Rails 7.1 Dockerfile. It is needed for the next changes to run; the == operation in the condition.
It is to make the whole Dockerfiles have similar content, making it easier to debug issues in the future.
Update:
Actually, bash is required for the == operator.
The -e option is used to exit running the script immediately after a command returns with a non-zero status.

node.title: fix: Add cleanups in device,vlan and ports e2e tests to stabilise the CI pipeline

node.bodyText:
I believe that all of the occurrences of:
t.Error(err)
return

can be replaced by the following which provides additional logging context:
t.Fatal(err)

https://pkg.go.dev/testing#T.Fatal

A few more points are discussed here, https://chat.openai.com/share/4d97fa93-08b7-4e4d-8a7c-2343394a6ffe

we could handle the Close() and remapping of Stdout in a defer call so that it happens in error conditions
there are potential error conditions that are not being checked by the tests
Let's use the existing GenerateRandomString function (defined above) rather than adding a second function to serve the same purpose.

The random string should be generated once at the start of a test, and the same value should be used in all resource names for the test (so the test project and the test devices in that project should have the same random string in their names).

The project name prefix here should be passed in, not hard-coded to metal-cli-test-project; I see a couple orphaned projects from these tests, but I can't tell which tests they came from because of the generic prefix.
@aayushrangwala good call using t.Cleanup instead of defer. 👍
Ah right didnt notice as it recently got merged I guess
Done
Right. Fixed
Yes right. Fixed
The signature and implementation of this function shouldn't change; it should be used as-is.

The problem with the original function was that it would error out on smaller sized lengths - 5 for example. Somewhere in the history of this PR the random string length was modified from 32 to 5 and the E2E tests started failing.  We have seen more restrictive resource lengths introduced in the EM API, specifically around tags. I don't know if that was a motivation for the initial change.
Once the E2E tests started failing, I took a look at what would be needed to fix the base64-based GenerateRandomString function. The complexity hid the problem. As rewritten, the function can not fall into an error condition so the signature was modified to remove the unused error.  If we are ok with accepting that change in this PR, we'll see the echo of that change in this PR.
https://go.dev/play/p/Z2zkdK5lSEU
approving contingent on tests (which seem to be stuck)

node.title: Montana Elderly Residential Property Tax Credit (Renter/Homeowner)
node.body:
Fixed: #2579

<!--
copilot:all
-->
### <samp>🤖 Generated by Copilot at f3cb5b5</samp>

### Summary
:sparkles::page_facing_up::test_tube:

<!--
1.  :sparkles: This emoji represents the addition of a new feature or enhancement, which is the main purpose of the pull request. The Montana elderly homeowner/renter credit is a new feature that adds functionality and value to the policy engine.
2. :page_facing_up: This emoji represents the addition of new documentation or data, which is a significant part of the pull request. The changelog entry, the parameter files, and the test files are all examples of documentation or data that help explain and support the new feature.
3. :test_tube: This emoji represents the addition of new tests or refactoring of existing tests, which is another important part of the pull request. The test files are examples of tests that ensure the quality and reliability of the new feature and the policy engine.
-->
This pull request adds the Montana elderly homeowner/renter credit to the policy engine. It creates new parameter, variable, and test files for the credit computation and eligibility logic, based on the Montana tax code and forms. It also updates the changelog file to document the new feature and the required version bump.

> _`Montana_credit`_
> _New feature for the engine_
> _Autumn of one's life_

### Walkthrough
*  Add the Montana elderly homeowner/renter credit to the policy engine ([link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/3258/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-5885042762833a4aef51405a4036067e4e6aefa7a5091a2987d1d9d1fc2647e8R1-R4), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/3258/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-14e9ce3a91a1d3d6a4ec058c47b82050ae6dd00381c0bd6ec683da4bafdcd62bR1-R37), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/3258/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-2c9810939c2135dc8c1bb528d96dd398a64f6166307fa8b114a46b6f01a26806R1-R21), [link](https://github.com/PolicyEngine/policyengine-us/pull/3258/files?diff=unified&w=0#diff-b45eda50fbbf6c9ac1aa9ced8d8ad36aa93a4d0bac5a66b1ca0390a04ef26d78L1-R13))

Here are the legislative changes in the Montana 2022 tax form: (increased elderly homeowner/renter credit)
https://mtrevenue.gov/wp-content/uploads/dlm_uploads/2022/12/Form-2-2022-Instructions.pdf#page=5

Here's what it says in 2021 tax instructions:
https://mtrevenue.gov/wp-content/uploads/mdocs/form%202%202021%20instructions.pdf#page=5

@MaxGhenis
This credit is in FORM 2EC before year 2018 and was combined in FORM 2 in 2018

I double-checked the tax form and instructions each year:
https://mtrevenue.gov/publications/montana-individual-income-tax-return-form-2/
https://mtrevenue.gov/publications/montana-form-2-individual-income-tax-return-forms-and-instructions-includes-form-2ec/
Here's a 2EC evaluation file, talking about how cap_value changes:
https://leg.mt.gov/content/Committees/Interim/2019-2020/Revenue/Meetings/July-2020/Tax-Credit-Review/2EC-evaluation.pdf#page=10

In tax form

in 2022: cap = 1150
in 2018-2021: cap = 1000
before 2018, it shows in 2EC FORM and cap=1000, LINE11 (2017)
https://www.taxformfinder.org/forms/2019/2019-montana-form-2ec.pdf#page=1

I didn't see the $900 and $950 in any tax forms and doubt what GPT answered
thanks should you change line 4 to 2022 then?
yes, I am revising that now.
rename to standard_exclusion.yaml

And elsewhere

node.title: Fix broken hausdorff test
node.body:
This PR revises the gold result of hausdorff empty input test to address
an upstream change in cudf.

## Description
<!-- Provide a standalone description of changes in this PR. -->
<!-- Reference any issues closed by this PR with "closes #1234". -->
<!-- Note: The pull request title will be included in the CHANGELOG. -->

## Checklist
- [x] I am familiar with the [Contributing Guidelines](https://github.com/rapidsai/cuspatial/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).
- [x] New or existing tests cover these changes.
- [x] The documentation is up to date with these changes.

node.bodyText: Fix seems fine to me, although I wonder if maybe it should be changed the other way in the long term i.e. have cuspatial return an empty RangeIndex rather than force cudf to produce an empty Index.

node.title: New banner with cards are added to all pages
node.body:
issue #133 resolved

-Cards like banners are added on every page, like men, women kids, shoes, sales.
-Banner from all pages are responsive.
-For more 'pluggable look' library is used.
-All Images are good high quality
-5-6 different cards are added as banner with effects and slide animation 
-Title and description is meant to be meaningful with images and nav link.
-Every page, every card have unique image, title, description with well relatable meaning...
-On every page changes cards are added, yet code is also kept optimized, with no redundancy.
-Cards can be changed by mouse, or by clicking on a card then using keyboard buttons (to use keyboard focus on card i required)
here is screenshot of banner cards:
![Screenshot (114)](https://github.com/rohan9024/ecommerce/assets/110652247/597d52d2-ad7d-4654-84e0-89157ef5758b)
-page of shoes section
![Screenshot (115)](https://github.com/rohan9024/ecommerce/assets/110652247/c61fd1b3-99d3-482c-ac77-e65d10e0d3ff)
-responsive testing
![Screenshot (116)](https://github.com/rohan9024/ecommerce/assets/110652247/3dd29278-93a9-44d0-87d5-41454acfc616)
![Screenshot (117)](https://github.com/rohan9024/ecommerce/assets/110652247/d53b18bc-d67b-4eba-a25f-35667e7f462a)
-Can change the the cards as slides by both mouse and keyboard 
![Screenshot (118)](https://github.com/rohan9024/ecommerce/assets/110652247/80032e13-e856-43f1-8436-9f217ab20a4d)


please do check my pr, it was soo hard as react newbie 😅but it was so fun also😁
